1.text: Choose roses at the peak of their bloom for the most vibrant color.

2.text: Trim away the majority of the leaves from the roses’ stems.

3.text: Wrap a piece of twine around the stem of each rose and tie it in a bow.

4.text: Hang the roses upside down in a dry, airy place.

5.text: Check the roses every 5-10 days to see if they are dry to the touch.

6.text: Cut the stem away from the bud of the roses after they have fully dried.

7.text: Use a convection oven to dry roses in 3-4 hours.

8.text: Dry roses in 1-2 days with desiccant in the microwave.

9.text: Use clear polyester casting resin for the cheapest option.

10.text: Choose an epoxy resin if you want an amber cast to the finish.

11.text: Work in a well-ventilated area to combat the resin’s strong odor.

12.text: Wear rubber gloves to protect your hands from the resin.

13.text: Measure how much resin your mold will hold.

14.text: Pour enough resin into the disposable measuring cup to fill the mold.

15.text: Add the catalyst to the resin per the instructions on the resin container.

16.text: Stir the resin and catalyst with a wooden skewer for 60 seconds.

17.text: Pour the stirred resin into the mold.

18.text: Place the rose into the resin in the design that you want.

19.text: Set a timer for 10 minutes and let the resin set to a gel-like consistency.

20.text: Finalize the positioning once the resin is the right consistency.

21.text: Let the resin set for about 4 hours or until it is completely hardened.

22.text: Remove the mold from the resin to reveal your creation!
